subtitle: If you prefer, replace some of the meat with cooked rice for an all-in-one meal.

method.text: Place the cabbage in a large pan of boiling water and par-boil for 8-10 min or until just tender. Drain thoroughly. Rinse under cold water to refresh.
Meanwhile, heat the oil in a pan. Add the shallots and garlic and saute for 2-3 min or until softened.
Place the milk in a pan and bring to just below the boil. Crumble in the bread. Remove from heat and leave until absorbed and cool.
In a bowl, combine the minced beef and pork with the egg, herbs and seasoning. Stir in the cooled milk and bread mixture and cooled shallots and garlic. Mix thoroughly.
Divide the stuffing between the par-boiled cabbage leaves. Fold in both ends to enclose the filling and roll each up.

Melt the butter over the hob in a large ovenproof casserole dish. Add the onion and cook for 2-3 min or until softened. Stir in the chicken stock, passata and herbs. Bring to the boil then remove from the heat.
Arrange the cabbage rolls on top. Cover and cook in the oven for 45-60 min or until thoroughly cooked.

title: Cabbage leaves stuffed with minced beef and pork
